title: Nautilus Changes
body:
You guys remember the New Dawn Cinematic? How Nautilus was basically one of the most iconic villains of the cinematic because HE WAS THE ONLY ONE WHO GOT A KILL, TWO KILLS! Well, I personally think Nautilus should feel that way in-game, because he is kind of lack luster right now. He needs to retake his place as the king of crowd control.

{{champion:111}} **NAUTILUS**

**Base Stats**

- Health per Level increased to 90 from 86
- Base Mana increased to 315 from 284
- Movement Speed increased to 330 from 325
- Size increased please!

**Staggering Blow**

How it should feel like to be hit by Staggering Blow:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vzHrjOMfHPY#t=246

- Bonus Base Physical Damage increased to 10 from 2
- Bonus Physical Damage per Level increased to 7 from 6
- On-target Cool Down reduced to 6/5.5/5/4.5/4 seconds from 9/8/7/6/5 seconds
- (A Maybe Change) During Titan's Wrath, the primary target will get knocked in the direction of your cursor 300 units, stopping if they were to collide with a wall and taking 25% of the Staggering Blow damage again

**Dredge Line**

- Can now be charged, allowing the anchor to pierce through a wall after 1 second of channeling
- Cool Down decreased to 17/15/13/11/9 seconds from 18/16/14/12/10 seconds
- Mana Cost changed to 65/70/75/80/85 mana from 60/70/80/90/100 mana

**Titan's Wrath**

- Titan's Wrath bonus magic damage is all applied instantly to minions and monsters
- Mana Cost reduced to 60/65/70/75/80 mana from 80 mana at all ranks

**Riptide**

- Range increased to 800 from 600
- Now shoots out 4 pulses from 3 pulses
- Base Magic Damage per Wave decreased to 45/85/125/165/205 from 60/100/140/180/220
- Mana Cost reduced to 60/65/70/75/80 mana from 60/70/80/90/100 mana

**Depth Charge**

- Pass-through Knock Up Duration increased to 0.75 seconds from 0.5 seconds

-------------------------------------------------

Majority of these buffs are small. but there a few buffs that can make a difference and make Nautilus known as the King of Control again. Lots more AoE CC going around much more often and more reliability on his Riptide at the cost of some base damage, which was never it's main use anyway. Thoughts on what should stay on this list or leave?

Its not just Nautilus that needs it. All tank junglers need this. Riot needs to put more jungle staying power into Machete.

The problem with putting it on machete is that it'll buff all other junglers along the way- Yeah, Nautilus and Hecarim will benefit, but Lee Sin and whoever else is strong in the jungle right now will benefit equally, and probably end up getting even better results from it. Long story short, you need to put the buffs on the champions, otherwise strong champions will just become stronger while the weak become mediocre. Strong>weak, and Stronger is still >Mediocre.

The idea I was going with is that sustain junglers can first clear level 3 with full hp while most other junglers need to recall between buffs. If Machete gives %dmg reduction against monsters, then the sustain junglers still do the first clear while other junglers get more options. 

In this case, the sustain junglers don't gain anything considering they're already getting the maximum benefit that the current Machete iteration has to offer. In that case, if there are oppressive outliers such as Lee and Rek'Sai, then those 2 champions can be nerfed accordingly. 

Holistically, I see this to be a healthier and easier change than buffing every tank jungler in the game.  I say healthier because stat/kit buffs affect the champion in PvP cases as well (such as laning, should the player choose to play Support Naut for example). You want the response of a balance change to only cause changes within your considered philosophy. While this is impossible, scattered responses can be minimized, but now I'm just rambling.
